intro: Rhexia repanda, commonly known as the spreading rhexia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded habitats and thrives in partial to full shade. Its foliage consists of oval, dark green leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Rhexia repanda plays a vital role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in wetland environments.
